((OOC: Actually Myrmidon and Shard had already walked over to Hydras=
'
position - check two posts ago. Myrmidon and Shard were talking when
Myrm=
idon began looking around))

Myrmidon's grunt of assent was his only respon=
se to Hydras' query as
the six-changer warrior continued to look around war=
ily, his optics
keenly scanning the skyline. 

In the skies a small distort=
ion periodically appeared, looking more
like the ripples the heat of a hot =
day makes as it rises off stone. 

"There!" Myrmidon pointed as his weapons=
 locked in on something that
shimmered into view. That something looked som=
ething like a golden
colored disk with several small cannons positioned on =
it. 

Quickly the largest of them oriented on Myrmidon, and fired a
yellow-=
white beam that struck him full in the chest, and sent him
reeling back a f=
ew steps sending him to his knees. As the expression
drained from his face =
he fell over as his systems went off line. 

((OOC: Sorry, there was one cr=
itter I forgot to deal with when I
abruptly ended the battles. Hydras I sen=
ding you some mail on it.))
